VI.iii.1.A.4.b
.
Incarceration in and Transfer From a Foreign Penal Institution
No award adjustment is necessary when a beneficiary (including an apportionee) or their dependent is incarcerated in a foreign penal institution.  Claims processors must, however, determine whether an award adjustment is necessary under the provisions of
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.A.1.a
-
e
if the incarcerated individual
is later transferred to a U.S. penal institution to serve the remainder of the sentence, and
was incarcerated in the foreign penal institution for conviction of an offense that is equivalent to a
felony (if the beneficiary receives disability compensation or DIC), or
felony or misdemeanor (if the beneficiary receives pension).
Important
:  The effective date of the reduction or discontinuance is the 61
st
day of incarceration in the U.S. penal institution.
